business.headline: Gold loans under under scanner as RBI plans stricter norms for lenders: Report The RBI wants banks and non-banking financial companies (NBFCs) to conduct deeper background checks on borrowers and verify the ownership of the gold being pledged.
DA hike? Will central government employees receive good news before Holi?The government reviews DA twice a year; the January hike is announced around Holi, while July revision is around Diwali.

5 special fixed deposits offering up to 8.05% interest. Check details  These fixed deposits are available only for a limited period, with the last date for investing in these schemes being March 31, 2025.
Sensex rises 600 points, Nifty nears 22,550 as auto and metal stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 609.86 points to close at 74,340.09, while the NSE Nifty50 added 207.40 points to end at 22,544.70.

Britannia Industries CEO Rajneet Singh Kohli resignsKohli submitted his resignation on March 5, 2025, and the Board of Directors has taken note of it through a circular resolution passed on March 6, 2025. He will be relieved from his duties at the close of business hours on March 14, 2025.

You don't need employer's permission for these EPF account changesIf your UAN is already linked to Aadhaar, you can update personal details like name, date of birth, gender, nationality, parents' names, marital status, spouse's name, date of joining, and date of leaving, all without submitting any documents.

Sensex gains 600 points: Why is stock market rising despite early losses?Stock market gains: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 475.17 points to 74,205.40, while the NSE Nifty50 added 171.30 points to 22,508.60 as of 2:20 PM.

Infosys mandates 10-day office attendance, to track compliance: ReportInfosys has informed its technology workforce that a new system will track attendance and limit the number of work-from-home (WFH) days they can apply for.

Indian jewellers worry as Trump's reciprocal tariffs spark job loss fears: ReportKey Indian exports to the US include cut and polished diamonds, studded gold jewellery, plain gold jewellery, lab-grown diamonds, and silver jewellery.

Sensex, Nifty rally for 2nd straight day: Is D-Street ready for a bull run?The two-day recovery rally on Dalal Street, though encouraging, comes amid global uncertainty, particularly concerns over a possible trade war. While some experts remain cautious about calling this a full-fledged market recovery, they acknowledge that conditions are improving for a potential uptrend.

How much will Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs cost India?During a joint session of the US Congress, President Donald Trump said that other countries have charged the US high tariffs for years, and it was time to respond.

Delhi Mahila Samriddhi Scheme: Check if you are eligible for Rs 2,500 monthly aidThe Delhi government will launch an online portal where women can submit their applications. The IT department is also developing special software to verify eligibility.

entertainment.headline: Friends actor recalls 'toxic environment' on set: I had become so race-consciousActor Stephen Park shared his negative experiences on the set of Friends, highlighting racial insensitivity. Lisa Kudrow's No Good Deed: This dark comedy could have been darker and funnierLisa Kudrow and Ray Romano are beloved comedic actors. And they deserved better treatment than Netflix's No Good Deed, which is fine at best. The series is currently streaming on the OTT platform.

With Love, Meghan review: You are neither fancy nor rich enough for Markle's show Released-Wed Mar 05, 2025With Love, Meghan could have been a lovely show about cooking and lifestyle, but it becomes a window into Markle's pretentiousness. It can't do away with its elitism, the one thing that Markle stood against during her stint at the royal palace.

Netflix cancels Noah Centineo-led The Recruit after 2 seasonsStreaming giant Netflix has cancelled actor Noah Centineo-starrer The Recruit after only two seasons. The news was recently confirmed by the OTT platform.

Ali Fazal trains 7 hours a day for Rakht Brahmand, learns ancient martial artsAli Fazal undergoes 7-hour daily training, learning martial arts and perfecting diction for Rakht Brahmand. He calls the process "demanding but rewarding." The series also stars Samantha Ruth Prabhu.

Explained: The plagiarism controversy around BLACKPINK's Jennie's new song BLACKPINK member Jennie Kim released the teaser of her new single, 'Like Jennie', on social media, and several social media users, especially Indians, found it quite similar to Alia Bhatt's theme song from 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani'.

Anora OTT release: When and where to watch the Oscar-winning Best FilmThe Oscar-winning film 'Anora' is set to stream on JioHotstar from March 17. Directed by Sean Baker and starring Mikey Madison, who won Best Actress, the movie offers a thought-provoking narrative.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

BRIT Awards 2025: Charli XCX wins album of the year, full winners list hereCharli XCX emerged as a major winner at the Brit Awards 2025, securing multiple accolades. Artists including Sabrina Carpenter and Billie Eilish also took home some of the biggest awards of the night.

Honey Singh's Millionaire Delhi concert: A night of nostalgia, iconic hitsHoney Singh's Delhi concert was packed with nostalgic hits, emotional tributes, surprise guests, and exclusive remixes. The rapper promised bigger things ahead as his Millionaire Tour continues.

general news.headline: Unacceptable: UK condemns security breach during S Jaishankar's visitOn Wednesday, as Jaishankar was leaving the Chatham House venue, after a discussion, a man ran toward his car and tore the Indian national flag in front of police officers.

Actor Ranya Rao's first photo in custody surfaces after arrest for gold smugglingKannada actor Ranya Rao's first photo in custody emerged on Thursday as she remains in DRI custody after being caught smuggling 14.2 kg of gold worth Rs 12.86 crore.

'Pawned mother's gold': Boatman who earned crores during Maha Kumbh recalls gamblePintu Mallah, a struggling boatman, risked everything for Maha Kumbh 2025. His gamble paid off, earning his family Rs 30 crore and praise from Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath.

LIVE: Nasa's Athena lander begins final descent to Moon's South PoleAthena lander landing on moon south pole live updates: Intuitive Machines' Athena lunar lander has successfully entered Low Lunar Orbit (LLO) and is set for a historic touchdown near the Moon's South Pole to explore the lunar terrain and search for water ice, a crucial resource for future human missions. The lander is equipped with a deep-digging drill and a mass spectrometer to analyze lunar soil for substances like frozen water.

Cleric attacks Mohammed Shami for not observing roza, top Muslim body defends himIndian cricketer Mohammed Shami faced criticism from Muslim cleric Maulana Shahabuddin Razvi Bareilvi for not fasting during India's semi-final against Australia, calling it a sin and a crime against religious principles.

How Mona hid the sona. Gold smugglers and their sneaky tricksRanya Rao, actor and daughter of a top police officer, was nabbed while trying to smuggle gold into India. She was concealing gold bars in her clothing. Gold is among the top items smuggled into India, and in recent times, smugglers have become innovative and found new ways to sneak in the precious metal into India.

Sunil Chhetri comes out of international retirement, to play in FIFA's March windowSunil Chhetri has performed a retirement U-turn as he will be back in India colours during the March international window, AIFF announced on March 6. Chhetri retired from football in 2024.

French President, Britain PM may accompany Zelenskyy in US for peace dealFrench President Emmanuel Macron is planning a joint visit to Washington alongside Zelenskyy and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer to present a united European front to Trump, the French government said Wednesday.

Trump suspends military deportation flights: How much did it cost USThe US government stopped the use of military aircraft to transport migrants who entered the US illegally as it proved to be very costly, according to a report. How much do these flights cost?

Devendra Fadnavis says learning Marathi a must after RSS leader's comment sparks rowMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis asserted in the assembly that Marathi is the state's official language and must be learnt by all residents. He emphasised its cultural significance, calling it every citizen's duty to learn and respect it.

'Heartbroken parent': Top cop pens note on daughter Ranya Rao's arrestRamachandra Rao, father of arrested Kannada actor Ranya Rao, expressed shock over her arrest in a gold smuggling case. He said that she and her husband lived separately and distanced herself from the family. He asked everyone to be fair to him and his family, emphasising his integrity and lifelong service.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.
